intro: Oncostemum nitidulum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed oncostemum, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, smooth stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. Oncostemum nitidulum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
